node.title: This sleepy country town is a secretive centre for Big Pharma drug production
node.description: This is the strange story of how a small, unassuming country town and a native plant became the epicentre for a major pharmaceutical drug industry and an alleged criminal cartel.
node.content:
["Major pharmaceutical drug crops are a strange sight amongst\u00a0the family farms and peanut crops of Queensland's South Burnett region.", "The winding rows of native Duboisia\u00a0shrubs snake through red volcanic soils on a massive scale.", "Global pharmaceutical companies have quietly\u00a0built a\u00a0lucrative supply chain from the town of Kingaroy for decades.", "\"For a long time, there were a lot of secrets kept about Duboisia, for whatever reason\u00a0I don't know, because I saw there was no value in keeping things quiet.\" former grower Russell Exelby said.", "Duboisia leaves contain the drug hyoscine, which is highly sought after for its used in over-the-counter motion sickness and stomach pain\u00a0medications.", "", "
The South Burnett's Duboisia industry began during the Second World War.(ABC Southern QLD: Jon Daly)
", "A local Duboisia grower, speaking to the ABC on the condition of anonymity because of financial risk, said not even farmers knew much about the opaque supply chain of these drug companies.", "\"There's no price we can see as growers, we can't see supply and demand, we have no idea of how much is being produced, how much is used in manufacturing each year, so there's no visibility from the farm gate.\"", "Locals half-jokingly call the Duboisia\u00a0industry the \"Kingaroy Mafia\".", "Not too far from Kingaroy, barbed wire\u00a0fences and countless cameras encircle Alkaloids of Australia's\u00a0processing facility, typifying an industry of trade secrets\u00a0and fierce competition.", "", "
Alkaloids of Australia has been charged with criminal cartel offences.(ABC Southern QLD: Jon Daly)
", "
The alleged drug cartel
", "The Australian-owned company and its former export manager, Christopher Joyce, face 33 criminal cartel charges following an Australian Competition and Consumer Commission investigation.", "The ACCC alleges Alkaloids of Australia and other overseas suppliers of scopolamine fixed prices and restricted the chemical supply\u00a0to international manufacturers since 2009 when criminal cartel laws came into force in Australia.", "Mr Joyce has pleaded guilted to some charges and will be sentenced in the Australian Federal Court.\u00a0Alkaloids of Australia is yet to enter a plea.\u00a0", "\"The specific purpose of most cartels is to increase the profits of the cartel members by agreeing to act together instead of competing with each other,\"\u00a0ACCC Chair Rod Sims said in a statement.", "The maximum corporate penalty for each criminal offence is $10 million, and an individual may be sentenced to up to 10 years' imprisonment or fined $420,000.", "The ACCC declined to make further comments while the matter was before the court.", "", "
QLD's South Burnett region is a key production area for the world's hyoscine supply.(ABC Southern QLD: Jon Daly)
", "
Hidden in plain sight
", "The modern industry began during the Second World War when the Allied forces needed a source of hyoscine to\u00a0treat air and seasickness in soldiers.", "It began as a foraging industry in which enterprising Kingaroy locals would collect wild Duboisia from the bush.", "Mr Exelby has childhood memories of his father stomping into the scrub armed with a cane knife.", "\"The farmers used to just as supplementary income, cutting the Duboisia trees, obviously harvesting them for the drug content in the leaves, and that was the way the industry started,\" he said.", "As the industry matured, pharmaceutical companies established breeding programs and varieties with much higher drug content than wild predecessors.", "", "
Retired grower Russell Exelby says local farmers used to forage in the\u00a0bush for wild Duboisia trees to collect and sell.(ABC Southern QLD: Jon Daly)
", "The industry is now tightly controlled by overseas interests, most of whom are\u00a0India-based pharmaceutical companies.", "At the peak of his farming,\u00a0Mr Exelby\u00a0exported hundreds of tonnes of leaf to pharmaceutical companies in India.", "\"The crop gets grown here, goes overseas and then all the market is in India,\" Mr Exelby said.", "For many years, Mr Exelby said the South Burnett had\u00a0been a key production area for the world's hyoscine supply thanks to the native crop thriving in\u00a0the region's\u00a0red volcanic soils and climate.", "", "
High doses of hyoscine cause hallucinations and amnesia.(ABC Southern QLD: Jon Daly)
", "
The Devil's breath
", "Hyoscine, the drug produced in Duboisia leaves, is an alkaloid\u00a0substance related to\u00a0morphine, cocaine and nicotine.", "University of Queensland School of Pharmacy professor Kathryn Steadman said\u00a0the drug had\u00a0a\u00a0potent and dissociative effect on the human body.", "\"You get initially very dry-mouthed, you get very sleepy, and if you take even more than that, it will give you\u00a0hallucinations, and it has amnesic properties, so you'll forget the whole experience,\" she says.", "Duboisia has a long history in Indigenous culture\u00a0and was observed as being used in shamanistic rituals.", "Hyoscine is found in other plants abroad\u00a0and has the nickname\u00a0\"devil's breath\".", "The narcotic\u00a0has\u00a0been subject to\u00a0much urban myth, such as its\u00a0use as\u00a0a date rape\u00a0drug, and a truth serum used for interrogations.", "", "
University of Queensland pharmacologist Kathryn Steadman says sceintific literature suggests Duboisia has a long history of Indigenous use.(ABC Southern QLD: Jon Daly)
", "Dr Steadman said\u00a0small doses had\u00a0the beneficial effect of easing gastronomical discomfort or motion sickness.", "\"It's very, very powerful, and you need tiny quantities of it to get an effect,\" she said.", "Very high doses cause respiratory failure and death.", "In the past, South Burnett farmworkers have unwittingly overdosed by handling Duboisia leaves with bare hands.", "Locals call it \"getting corked\", a throwback to the plant's old name of \"corkwood\".", "Mr Exelby said there were plenty of strange stories over the years, including naked men scaling the flagpole at the post office.", "\"It is potent, and it's not to be messed with. In the pure form, it's deadly.\"", "", "
Pharmaceutical companies are now looking to \"vertically integrate\" and are buying up farmland to grow their own crops.(ABC Southern QLD: Jon Daly)
", "
A culture of secrecy
", "The ABC contacted several Duboisia companies and growers to discuss the industry, and all declined to comment, did not respond or were not available.", "Ian Crosthwaite is a retired agronomist with 20 years of experience in the Duboisia industry and said\u00a0it had always been opaque and was becoming even more so.", "Farmers are separated into \"buyer groups\" contracted to supply certain Duboisia companies.", "They grow specific varieties, use shared harvesting equipment and do not associate with other buyer groups.", "They are not easy to join.", "\"If a grower decides to grow Duboisia, he goes to the company that is going to buy the product and says, 'do you need more leaf', and if they say 'yes', they'll be incorporated into that group, and it\u00a0will supply that grower with the cuttings they need to plant the crop,\" Mr Crosthwaite said.", "", "
Former agronomist Ian Crosthwaite says the industry has always been shrouded in secrecy.(ABC Southern QLD: Jon Daly)
", "\"If someone is growing wheat, they can just go and buy some wheat seed, plant it and harvest a crop and look round for a market. The Duboisia industry does not work like that.\"", "To join a buyer group, the\u00a0anonymous grower said\u00a0farmers had to sign \"controlling\" and exclusive supply contracts.", "\"You're forced to really sell it to a handful of companies, and that's probably the biggest issue is just the lack of markets to sell it to, there are no other options, so you basically have to accept their terms and conditions and supply them, and if you don't like it, you get out of the industry,\" the grower said.", "", "
Pharmaceutical companies are vertically integrating by buying farmland in the South Burnett.\u00a0(ABC Southern QLD: Jon Daly)
", "
Corporate control
", "Mr Crosthwaite said each company is protective of the competitive edge, and much of that comes from expensive breeding programs and varieties.", "\"They'll register the DNA of those plants, so if they think it's grown somewhere else it shouldn't be, they can those varieties\u00a0tested to see what they are,\" he said.", "\"They're in a very, very competitive world, and so any marketing edge or any edge they can get, they will keep that.\"", "A newer trend to emerge in the Duboisia industry is \"vertical integration\".", "Pharmaceutical companies are increasingly buying\u00a0farmland in the South Burnett to grow their own crops\u00a0and do away with contracted growers.", "", "
Duboisia production quietly contributes millions of dollars to South Burnett's economy each year.(ABC Southern QLD: Jon Daly)
", "The anonymous grower said\u00a0the trend did not bode well for the future of local growers.", "Mr Exelby is comfortably retired and enjoys\u00a0a view of the weaving Duboisia crops\u00a0and farmlands from his back veranda.", "\"The Duboisia industry has been good to us,\" he said.", "The sentiment is shared by others that have\u00a0quietly profited from the deep pockets of Big Pharma for many years.", "Watch this story on ABC TV's Landline at 12:30pm on Sunday, or on\u00a0iview."]
